fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let f\colon X\to S be a flat projective morphism such that, in the Stein factorisation f=f''f', the morphism f'\colon X\to S' is flat and has integral geometric fibres (and thus satisfies the hypotheses of ), and such that the finite morphism f''\colon S'\to is flat. Then \underline {\operatorname {Pic}}_{X/S} exists and (with the notation introduced in FGA 3.II, §C.2) we have a canonical isomorphism \underline {\operatorname {Pic}}_{X/S} \xrightarrow {\sim } \prod _{S'/S} \underline {\operatorname {Pic}}_{X/S'}.
